text:
(1) 120 Circle Road, west side, between Redmond and New York Aves., showing the A. T. Pouch residence.

August 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, another view.

August 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) 120 Circle Road, west side, between Redmond and New York Aves., showing the A. T. Pouch residence.

August 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, another view.

August 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

Circle Road, east side, between Redmond and New York Aves. (location of house). Also shown is a general view eastward toward the Lower New York Bay as seen from the A.T. Pouch residence, at 120 Circle Road.

August 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

Circle Road, east side, north from Redmond Ave. (location of house). Also shown is a panoramic view eastward toward the Lower New York Bay. The vantage point is the A.T. Pouch residence, at 120 Circle Road.

August 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Circle Road(partially seen, extreme left), east side (house thereon), north of Redmond Ave., showing the Notman residence. Also shown is a panoramic view eastward toward the Lower New York Bay with Hoffman Island discernible to the right of the mansion.

August 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, another view. The vantage point is the A. T. Pouch residence at No. 120 Circle Road.

August 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Circle Road(partially seen, extreme left), east side (house thereon), north of Redmond Ave., showing the Notman residence. Also shown is a panoramic view eastward toward the Lower New York Bay with Hoffman Island discernible to the right of the mansion.

August 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, another view. The vantage point is the A. T. Pouch residence at No. 120 Circle Road.

August 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
